epd_metadata.programme_operator_address: Suite 2600, 101 Marietta St NW, Atlanta, Georgia 30303, USA
epd_metadata.epd_process_certification: Epsten Group, Inc., Katherine McFeaters; Accredited by: A2LA, Certificate #3142.03

epd_owner.name: Holcim (Australia) Pty Ltd
epd_owner.address: Level 7, 799 Pacific Highway, Chatswood NSW 2067, Australia

product_description.product_name: ViroDecs™ Ready-mix concrete South Australia - Adelaide - ECOPact Range
product_description.product_use: Construction material for residential, high-end, and infrastructure projects including high-rise buildings, dams, spillways, roads, bridges, and public works infrastructure.
strength_classes: Normal-class: designed for residential applications, low rise buildings, paving, driveways etc.

Special-class: allows incorporation of special requirements such as high-strength, high durability, marine application, post-tensioned, high-pumpability, super workable, piling concrete, architectural off-form finishes, and decorative applications.
product_description.packaging: Delivered in bulk with no packaging
product_description.classification: Non-Dangerous Goods according to the Australian Code for the Transport of Dangerous Goods by Road and Rail

lca_information.reference_service_life: Not specified (scope is cradle to gate)
databases_and_software_used: Australian National Life Cycle Inventory Database (AusLCI) (2018)
Global Cement and Concrete (GCCA) EPD Tool Project Database version 3.1 (International Version) (2021)
Product specific EPDs for pigments and fibres

allocation.method: Physical allocation based on weight (quarries) or m3 of concrete (batching plant); economic allocation when physical not possible

lca_information.cut_off_criteria: No flows excluded on basis of cut-off criteria

data_quality.foreground_data: Medium or higher for geographic and temporal representativeness
data_quality.background_data: Updated within 10 years as required under PCR 2019:14 version 1.11

lca_information.system_boundaries: Cradle to gate; excludes life cycle stages beyond Holcim's gate and environmental impacts relating to personnel, infrastructure and production equipment not directly consumed in the process

transport_and_installation.packaging_waste: Estimated based on researched packaging material and sizes; default background data from LCA databases used

end_of_life.description: Not included in LCA; described for whole-of-life building studies
scenarios: Disposal of concrete at landfill site
Reuse of recovered concrete elements in new construction works
Use of concrete debris in land restoration
Crushing/recycling of concrete: (a) crushed concrete substitutes primary material without further processing, (b) substitution of natural aggregates in fresh concrete
end_of_life.note: Scenarios 2, 3 and 4 can result in benefits and loads outside system boundary and should be considered in whole-of-life studies

carbon_emission_context.global_demand: Growing due to population growth and urbanisation
carbon_emission_context.concrete_usage: Second most used commodity worldwide after water
carbon_emission_context.concrete_impact: Major contributor to embodied GHG emissions in infrastructure and property assets
carbon_emission_context.carbonation_process: Natural absorption of CO2 by concrete over its lifetime (not included in this EPD)
carbon_emission_context.offset_note: CO2 absorption not considered in this EPD and not reflected in results

fly_ash.treatment: Treated as waste material, burden-free except transport impacts

silica_fume.treatment: Treated as waste material, burden-free except transport impacts

ground_granulated_blast_furnace_slag.treatment: Allocated economically due to significant economic value at collection

recycled_materials_handling.allocation_approach: AusLCI LCA database allocation approach adopted for secondary data and processes

additional_info.sustainability_commitment: Holcim has industry’s first 2050 net-zero targets endorsed by Science Based Targets initiative (SBTi)
additional_info.epd_process_certification: First for concrete and any product in Australia; enables in-house compliant EPD production
data_sources: Actual transport distances and loads per trip
additional_info.disclaimer: This publication supersedes all previous literature; specifications may change; users must determine suitability; Holcim accepts no liability for loss or damage from reliance on this information
additional_info.trademarks: “Strength. Performance. Passion.” and “ViroDecs” are trademarks of Holcim (Australia) Pty Ltd
